title: Biden considering Lisa Cook for Fed seat: report
text: President Joe Biden is considering nominating Michigan State University economist Lisa Cook to the Federal Reserve Board, Axios reported late Wednesday. Cook would be the first Black woman on the Fed board.

title: Hedge fund honcho Dan Loeb of Third Point talks short selling madness
text: Loeb said his firm was able to "sidestep substantial losses" by sticking with "higher net and low gross exposure" and by cutting its losses after "a few previous painful experiences of our own taking positions against companies with large short interests.".

That's the broad perspective of legendary investor, Louis Navellier.

title: Markets tap brakes on asset rise after getting ahead of recovery
text: Stocks were flat in early trading in Asia on Thursday as investors kept tapping the brakes on runs in asset prices after taking in tepid U.S. inflation data and comments from the Federal Reserve chief affirming the outlook for a slow recovery.

title: Powell's Valentine to the Fed: 'I love my job'
text: With Valentine's Day just around the corner, and less than a year to go in his four-year term, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday declared his love for the job - just as President Joe Biden may be weighing whether to let him keep it.

title: How NYSE, Nasdaq's battle with SEC over market data could affect retail investors
text: Stock exchanges are stepping up their fight against the Securities and Exchange Commission and its attempt to reform rules about what kinds of market data it must provide to the public and at what prices, and the outcome could have an outsized impact on the trajectory of federal securities regulation in the years and decades ahead, experts say.

title: Dividend Income Summary: Lanny's January 2021 Summary
text: Growing your dividend income takes time and consistency. Investing as often, and early, as you can allows compound interest (aka dividends) to work its magic. Despite the pandemic from COVID-19, dividend income continues to grow, due primarily to additional investment and reinvestment.

title: The Stock Market Bubble Is Just Getting Started
text: Valuations are high in historical terms, mostly because interest rates are very low, and they could be beginning the kind of rapid increase that is a key element of bubbles.

title: Dow seesaws its way to a record close, Fed Chair says low rates are here to stay
text: 4 pm: Markets mixed at Wednesday's end The Dow found its way to positive territory — and a record high — before the close, ending up 62 points, 0.2%, at 31,438. The Nasdaq Composite slipped 31 points, 0.3%, to 13,973, and the S&P 500 ticked down a single point, less than 0.1%, to 3,910.

title: Dow closes at record high after Powell backs continued low interest rates
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at a record high on Wednesday as Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell delivered a speech to the Economic Club of New York. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite both closed lower.  Powell stressed that accommodative monetary policy is still necessary to combat the economic uncertainty caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: The Fed says US unemployment is actually about 10% — nearly double the official rate and matching the worst of the Great Recession
text: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday that US unemployment is about 10% — or nearly twice the officially recorded rate. That roughly equal to Great Recession levels more than a decade ago. The Fed chair made the remarks in a speech on strengthening a battered labor market at the Economic Club of New York. title: The Fed's new inflation target tees up strong returns for unloved stocks, Jefferies says
text: The Federal Reserve is poised to maintain an accommodative policy stance for the foreseeable future. That playbook should serve as a major boon for the market's long-neglected stocks, Jefferies strategists said Wednesday. The central bank updated its inflation target in August after years of weaker-than-expected price growth. Known as average inflation targeting, the framework seeks inflation that averages 2% over time and, therefore, allows for periods of above-2% inflation. The new policy signals the Fed will keep easy monetary conditions in place well into the US economic recovery.

title: Fed's Powell Calls for 'Society-Wide Commitment' on Jobs
text: Feb.10 -- Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell says a "society-wide commitment" is needed to achieve and sustain maximum employment. He speaks during a speech to the Economic Club of New York.

title: Fed Chair Powell calls for national drive for full employment
text: Invoking post-World War II efforts to reach full employment and pledging continued loose monetary policy to help the process, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made a broad call Wednesday for a "society-wide commitment" to get Americans back to work, particularly minorities and those ousted from lower-paying jobs during the pandemic.

title: U.S. January budget deficit hits record $163 billion as new aid checks sent out
text: The U.S. government posted a budget deficit of $163 billion in January, a record high for the month and a $130 billion jump from the deficit in the same month last year, as a new round of direct payments to individuals were distributed, the Treasury said on Wednesday.

title: Capitol Report: U.S. budget deficit jumps to $163 billion in January as Washington pumps more stimulus into the economy
text: The U.S. budget deficit increased sharply in January to $163 billion as Washington funneled more financial aid to families and unemployed workers to cushion the latest blow from the coronavirus pandemic.
